meanings.definition: To bargain or haggle over the price of something.
meanings.sent1: She was jewing with the seller over the cost of the antique vase.
meanings.sent2: The customers were jewing at the flea market to get the best deals.
meanings.sent3: The children were jewing playfully over who would get the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: The two friends were jewing like skilled negotiators in a high-stakes game.
meanings.sent5: The image of her jewing for a discount was etched in his memory.

meanings.definition: To act in a dishonest or deceitful manner.
meanings.sent1: He was caught jewing by taking credit for someone else's work.
meanings.sent2: The scammer was jewing unsuspecting victims out of their money.
meanings.sent3: The cat was jewing by pretending to be stuck in a tree for attention.
meanings.sent4: The politician was jewing the public with false promises.
meanings.sent5: The idea of jewing his way out of trouble only led to more problems.

meanings.definition: The practice or culture of Judaism.
meanings.sent1: She studied the history of jewing to better understand her heritage.
meanings.sent2: The museum showcased artifacts related to the ancient practice of jewing.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show featured a humorous skit about the traditions of jewing.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of jewing was reflected in the colorful celebrations of the community.
meanings.sent5: The essence of jewing was captured in the heartfelt prayers of the congregation.
